intro: Deiregyne nelsonii subsp. obtusa, commonly known as the broad-leafed deiregyne, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
